description: a(n) = (sum of divisors of n) - phi(n) - (number of divisors of n).
comments: Always >= 0 for n >= 2. a(n)=0 if and only if n is prime.If n is an even semiprime > 4 (A100484), then a(n) = n. - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Dec 25 2013
references: D. S. Mitrinovic et al., Handbook of Number Theory, Kluwer, Section I.3.1 (but they have "tau" instead of "sigma").
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..10000
N. J. A. Sloane, My favorite integer sequences, in Sequences and their Applications (Proceedings of SETA '98).
maple: with(numtheory); A046520:=n->sigma(n)-phi(n)-tau(n); seq(A046520(n), n=1..100); # _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Dec 25 2013
mathematica: DivisorSigma[1, #] - EulerPhi[#] - DivisorSigma[0, #] & /@ Range[74] (* _Jayanta Basu_, Jun 27 2013 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
